column4: hi.. I am trying to download this file via wget  http://scripts.xchat.centrum.cz/scripts/online_txt.php?nick=SexyLeon
when I download it via wget, I get a void file, there is no zero
how did you download that page? with firefox?
when I do cat that_downloaded_page I always can't see anything
that's because you're not looking straight - the file has no LF at the end, so the 0 gets put at the start of your next porompt
aha... so I need to modify the file first?
I would think so.. being able to download a "0" is.... limited in functionality, I would say
whatever, why don't you make things easier on yourself and put something in there that will show up easily ?
echo will normally insert a LF at the end, so you already did something non-standard to it
no, of course not - how about "echo TEST > file" ?
anyway, it works for me.. thank you
